timeline.bodyText: Why did you remove this line?
timeline.author: kaikreuzer

replies.bodyText: I keep the status INITIALIZING until the device is fully initialized. For non-battery devices this will be done with the next status update, for battery-powered devices this could take longer until the device wakes up. UNKOWN sounds like an error, even I now that the device is not yet initialized
replies.author: markus7017

replies.bodyText: I am pretty sure that we discussed this before (when adding that line), but I can certainly again point you to the developer docs: https://github.com/openhab/openhab-core/blob/master/tools/archetype/binding/src/main/resources/archetype-resources/src/main/java/internal/__bindingIdCamelCase__Handler.java#L69-L79
replies.author: kaikreuzer

timeline.bodyText: Why did you remove the message from the Thing status? The Thing status is the correct place for it.
timeline.author: kaikreuzer

replies.bodyText:
My understanding is that
updateStatus(ThingStatus.OFFLINE, ThingStatusDetail.CONFIGURATION_ERROR,
"@text/offline.conf-error-wrong-mode")
pulls up the language resource "offline.conf-error-wrong-mode" to get this messages from shelly_de.properties/shelly.properties. Isn't it this the case?
So a info message goes to the log and the thing status gets updated with the genral message - or is there a way to pass parameters to the messages retrived from the properties file?
replies.author: markus7017

replies.bodyText:
is there a way to pass parameters to the messages retrived from the properties file?

There is, see https://www.openhab.org/docs/developer/utils/i18n.html#i18n-text-provider-api.
replies.author: kaikreuzer

replies.bodyText: ok, I figured out the i18nProvider stuff, but how to format the message in the properties file to inject parameters?
replies.author: markus7017

replies.bodyText: @kaikreuzer could you point me to the solution?
replies.author: markus7017
